The state of a bounded linear operator on a non - Archimedean normed space
By Robert L.  Ellis^ ) at Durham,  N.  C,  USA
Introduction
Taylor and Halberg [ 8 ] introduced the concept of the state of a bounded linear operator Г on a normed space in order to investigate the existence and the continuity of the inverse operator Г~\ The operator T' conjugate to T assumes an important role in their investigations,  and their results are displayed in what they call a state diagram. 
The purpose of this paper is to consider the same problem when Г is a bounded linear operator on a non - Archimedean normed space over a field К with a non - Archimedean absolute value.  For each non - zero spherically complete non - Archimedean normed space over К ( defined in section 1 ) an operator analogous to the conjugate of T is introduced and a state diagram is constructed.  Results which are analogous to those in the ordinary case are obtained by means of methods similar to those of Taylor and Halberg.
